t: Joel 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
The Land Laid Waste
Hear*pn this, you elders, And*ld give ear, all you inhabitants of the land! Has*ld anything*i like*i this happened in your days, Or*ld even in the days of your fathers?
Tell*ld your children about it, Let*ild your children tell*i their children, And*ld their children another generation.
What*ld the chewing locust left, the swarming locust has eaten; What*ld the swarming locust left, the crawling locust has eaten; And*ld what the crawling locust left, the consuming locust has eaten.
Awake,*ln you drunkards, and weep; And*ld wail, all you drinkers of wine, Because*ld of the new wine, For*ld it has been cut off from your mouth.
For*ld a nation has come up against My land, Strong,*ld and without number; His*ld teeth are*i the teeth of a lion, And*ld he has the fangs of a fierce lion.
He*ld has laid waste My vine, And*ld ruined My fig tree; He*ld has stripped it bare and thrown it*i away; Its*ld branches are made white.
Lament*ln like a virgin girded with sackcloth For*ld the husband of her youth.
The*ld grain offering and the drink offering Have*ld been cut off from the house of the Lord;*s The*ld priests mourn, who minister to the Lord.*s
The*ld field is wasted, The*ld land mourns; For*ld the grain is ruined, The*ld new wine is dried up, The*ld oil fails.
Be*ln ashamed, you farmers, Wail,*ld you vinedressers, For*ld the wheat and the barley; Because*ld the harvest of the field has perished.

The*ld vine has dried up, And*ld the fig tree has withered; The*ld pomegranate tree, The*ld palm tree also, And*ld the apple tree— All*ld the trees of the field are withered; Surely*ld joy has withered away from the sons of men.
Mourning for the Land

Gird*pn yourselves and lament, you priests; Wail,*ld you who minister before the altar; Come,*ld lie all night in sackcloth, You*ld who minister to my God; For*ld the grain offering and the drink offering Are*ld withheld from the house of your God.
Consecrate*ld a fast, Call*ld a sacred assembly; Gather*ld the elders And*ild all the inhabitants of the land Into*ild the house of the Lord*s your God, And*ld cry out to the Lord.*s
Alas*ln for the day! For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i at hand; It*ld shall come as destruction from the Almighty.
Is*ld not the food cut off before our eyes, Joy*ld and gladness from the house of our God?
The*ld seed shrivels under the clods, Storehouses*ld are in shambles; Barns*ld are broken down, For*ld the grain has withered.
How*ld the animals groan! The*ld herds of cattle are restless, Because*ld they have no pasture; Even*ld the flocks of sheep suffer punishment.
O*ln Lord,*s to You I cry out; For*ld fire has devoured the open pastures, And*ld a flame has burned all the trees of the field.
The*ld beasts of the field also cry out to You, For*ld the water brooks are dried up, And*ld fire has devoured the open pastures.
Joel 2
The Day of the Lord
Blow*pn the trumpet in Zion, And*ld sound an alarm in My holy mountain! Let*ld all the inhabitants of the land tremble; For*ld the day of the Lord*s is coming, For*ld it is at hand:

A*ld day of darkness and gloominess, A*ld day of clouds and thick darkness, Like*ld the morning clouds*i spread over the mountains. A*ld people come,*i great and strong, The*ld like of whom has never been; Nor*ld will there ever be any such*i after them, Even*ld for many successive generations.
A*ln fire devours before them, And*ld behind them a flame burns; The*ld land is*i like the Garden of Eden before them, And*ld behind them a desolate wilderness; Surely*ld nothing shall escape them.
Their*ld appearance is like the appearance of horses; And*ld like swift steeds, so they run.
With*ld a noise like chariots Over*ld mountaintops they leap, Like*ld the noise of a flaming fire that devours the stubble, Like*ld a strong people set in battle array.
Before*ln them the people writhe in pain; All*ld faces are drained of color.
They*ld run like mighty men, They*ld climb the wall like men of war; Every*ld one marches in formation, And*ld they do not break ranks.
They*ld do not push one another; Every*ld one marches in his own column. Though*ld they lunge between the weapons, They*ld are not cut down.
They*ld run to and fro in the city, They*ld run on the wall; They*ld climb into the houses, They*ld enter at the windows like a thief.
The*ln earth quakes before them, The*ld heavens tremble; The*ld sun and moon grow dark, And*ld the stars diminish their brightness.

The*ld Lord*s gives voice before His army, For*ld His camp is very great; For*ld strong is*i the*i One*i who executes His word. For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i great and very terrible; Who*ld can endure it?
A Call to Repentance
“Now,*pn therefore,” says the Lord,*s “Turn*ld to Me with all your heart, With*ld fasting, with weeping, and with mourning.”
So*ld rend your heart, and not your garments; Return*ld to the Lord*s your God, For*ld He is*i gracious and merciful, Slow*ld to anger, and of great kindness; And*ld He relents from doing harm.
Who*ld knows if*i He will turn and relent, And*ld leave a blessing behind Him— A*ld grain offering and a drink offering For*ld the Lord*s your God?
Blow*ld the trumpet in Zion, Consecrate*ld a fast, Call*ld a sacred assembly;

Gather*ld the people, Sanctify*ld the congregation, Assemble*ld the elders, Gather*ld the children and nursing babes; Let*ld the bridegroom go out from his chamber, And*ld the bride from her dressing room.

Let*ld the priests, who minister to the Lord,*s Weep*ld between the porch and the altar; Let*ld them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,*s And*ld do not give Your heritage to reproach, That*ld the nations should rule over them. Why*ld should they say among the peoples, ‘Where*ld is*i their God?’”
The Land Refreshed
Then*pn the Lord*s will be zealous for His land, And*ld pity His people.

The*ld Lord*s will answer and say to His people, “Behold,*ld I will send you grain and new wine and oil, And*ld you will be satisfied by them; I*ld will no longer make you a reproach among the nations.

“But*ln I will remove far from you the northern army,*i And*ld will drive him away into a barren and desolate land, With*ld his face toward the eastern sea And*ld his back toward the western sea; His*ld stench will come up, And*ld his foul odor will rise, Because*ld he has done monstrous things.”
Fear*ln not, O land; Be*ld glad and rejoice, For*ld the Lord*s has done marvelous things!
Do*ld not be afraid, you beasts of the field; For*ld the open pastures are springing up, And*ld the tree bears its fruit; The*ld fig tree and the vine yield their strength.

Be*ld glad then, you children of Zion, And*ld rejoice in the Lord*s your God; For*ld He has given you the former rain faithfully, And*ld He will cause the rain to come down for you— The*ld former rain, And*ld the latter rain in the first month.*i
The*ld threshing floors shall be full of wheat, And*ld the vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
“So*ln I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The*ld crawling locust, The*ld consuming locust, And*ld the chewing locust, My*ld great army which I sent among you.
You*ld shall eat in plenty and be satisfied, And*ld praise the name of the Lord*s your God, Who*ld has dealt wondrously with you; And*ld My people shall never be put to shame.
Then*ld you shall know that I am*i in the midst of Israel: I*ld am*i the Lord*s your God And*ld there is no other. My*ld people shall never be put to shame.
God’s Spirit Poured Out

“And*pn it shall come to pass afterward That*ld I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh; Your*ld sons and your daughters shall prophesy, Your*ld old men shall dream dreams, Your*ld young men shall see visions.
And*ld also on My*i menservants and on My*i maidservants I*ld will pour out My Spirit in those days.
“And*ln I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth: Blood*ld and fire and pillars of smoke.
The*ld sun shall be turned into darkness, And*ld the moon into blood, Before*ld the coming of the great and awesome day of the Lord.*s

And*ld it shall come to pass That*ild whoever calls on the name of the Lord*s Shall*ld be saved. For*ld in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be deliverance, As*ld the Lord*s has said, Among*ld the remnant whom the Lord*s calls.
Joel 3
God Judges the Nations
“For*pn behold, in those days and at that time, When*ld I bring back the captives of Judah and Jerusalem,

I*ld will also gather all nations, And*ld bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat; And*ld I will enter into judgment with them there On*ld account of My people, My heritage Israel, Whom*ld they have scattered among the nations; They*ld have also divided up My land.
They*ld have cast lots for My people, Have*ld given a boy as*i payment*i for a harlot, And*ld sold a girl for wine, that they may drink.

“Indeed,*ln what have you to do with Me, O*ld Tyre and Sidon, and all the coasts of Philistia? Will*ld you retaliate against Me? But*ld if you retaliate against Me, Swiftly*ld and speedily I will return your retaliation upon your own head;
Because*ld you have taken My silver and My gold, And*ld have carried into your temples My prized possessions.
Also*ld the people of Judah and the people of Jerusalem You*ld have sold to the Greeks, That*ld you may remove them far from their borders.
“Behold,*ln I will raise them Out*ld of the place to which you have sold them, And*ld will return your retaliation upon your own head.
I*ld will sell your sons and your daughters Into*ld the hand of the people of Judah, And*ld they will sell them to the Sabeans, To*ld a people far off; For*ld the Lord*s has spoken.”
Proclaim*ln this among the nations: “Prepare*ld for war! Wake*ld up the mighty men, Let*ld all the men of war draw near, Let*ld them come up.
Beat*ld your plowshares into swords And*ld your pruning hooks into spears; Let*ld the weak say, ‘I am*i strong.’”
Assemble*ld and come, all you nations, And*ld gather together all around. Cause*ld Your mighty ones to go down there, O Lord.*s
“Let*ln the nations be wakened, and come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat; For*ld there I will sit to judge all the surrounding nations.
Put*ld in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come,*ld go down; For*ld the winepress is full, The*ld vats overflow— For*ld their wickedness is*i great.”
Multitudes,*ln multitudes in the valley of decision! For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i near in the valley of decision.
The*ld sun and moon will grow dark, And*ld the stars will diminish their brightness.

The*ld Lord*s also will roar from Zion, And*ld utter His voice from Jerusalem; The*ld heavens and earth will shake; But*ld the Lord*s will be a shelter for His people, And*ld the strength of the children of Israel.
“So*ln you shall know that I am*i the Lord*s your God, Dwelling*ld in Zion My holy mountain. Then*ld Jerusalem shall be holy, And*ld no aliens shall ever pass through her again.”
God Blesses His People

And*pn it will come to pass in that day That*ild the mountains shall drip with new wine, The*ld hills shall flow with milk, And*ld all the brooks of Judah shall be flooded with water; A*ld fountain shall flow from the house of the Lord*s And*ld water the Valley of Acacias.
“Egypt*ln shall be a desolation, And*ld Edom a desolate wilderness, Because*ld of violence against*i the people of Judah, For*ld they have shed innocent blood in their land.
But*ld Judah shall abide forever, And*ld Jerusalem from generation to generation.
For*ld I will acquit them of the guilt of bloodshed, whom I had not acquitted; For*ld the Lord*s dwells in Zion.”
